intro: Clidemia hammelii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and is often found growing in moist, shaded areas. It plays an important role in the native ecosystems of Hawaii, providing nectar for various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in other tropical regions.
